results.title: Do you know. Vol. 2
results.brief_description: Features Stanley Crick (Australian Cinema pioneer in the role of Lord Mayor of Sydney 1940-42) and Peter Mullens, decathlon athlete. Narrated by Howard Craven.

results.title: Do you ever wonder?
results.creator_credit: Jerry Harned, Gary Baker and Johnson-Nyquist Productions
results.brief_description: A film exploring the identity problems faced by young people built around four soft rock songs, which provide the only commentary. A father, trying to bridge the generation gap, attempts to reach an understanding with his son; a young girl trying to find herself, asks if anyone would care if she resigned from the human race; and the final segment, performed by a mime, illustrates how people build walls around themselves.

results.title: Do unto others
results.brief_description: Courtesy and civilised personal behaviour as the basis of road safety. How bullying, rudeness and impatience set up a series of dangerous chain reactions; various road situations showing the danger of the driver’s sense of power, and the need for courtesy as a complement to modern highway design. The risks to pedestrians, especially the old and very young. An old blind man and a schoolboy provide a story thread.

results.title: Do unto animals
results.creator_credit: H McClure and United States. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Briefly describes the organisation and purpose of the National Livestock Loss Prevention Board. Explains how cattle, sheep and hogs may be killed or badly bruised through wrong handling on the way to slaughter-yards. Shows examples of damaged carcasses, thus resulting in lower-grade meat. Also shows right and wrong methods of preparing road and railway trucks for transport of animals, of treating animals prior to transit and in transit, of loading and unloading animals.

results.title: Do they know it's Christmas?
results.creator_credit: Rob Wright, Dave Bridges and PolyGram Music Video
results.brief_description: Documentary music video presenting an inside look at some of the world’s leading rock bands from the UK and the US as they come together as “Band Aid” to produce the song “Do they know it’s Christmas?” to raise funds for the starving victims of Ethiopia. Members of “Band Aid” include Bob Geldoff, Bono, Midge Ure, David Bowie, Paul McCartney, George Michael, Boy George and many more.

results.title: Do the right thing
results.creator_credit: Spike Lee, Universal Pictures and 40 Acres and a Mule Filmworks
results.brief_description: Possibly the most significant English-language release of the 1980’s, “Do the Right Thing” is a powerful, explosive and rigorously damning exploration of American racism. In a hot Brooklyn summer, tensions between the various inhabitants of the suburb of Bedford-Stuyvesant increase due to the escalating amount of race violence and poverty in the city. A largely African-American community, the young people hang out at the local Pizzeria run by an Italian family. As the heat of the summer increases the minor insults and rivalry between the black and white people in the suburbs escalate into barely contained rage which is unleashed when a young black man is bashed by the police. The film ends with quotes by Martin Luther King Jr., and by Malcolm X. Spike Lee’s furious indictment of racism finally is more in the spirit of the latter man. With Ossie Davis, Ruby Dee, Danny Aiello, John Turturro and John Savage.

results.title: Do or die = The Rubicon
results.creator_credit: Rowan Woods, Lavinia Warner, John Edwards, Warner Sister Film and TV Ltd, British Sky Broadcasting, Southern Star Entertainment and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: A British-Australia co-production, “Do or die” is a 2 part mini series about the plight of a British mother to reconnect with a past lover from Australia who holds the key to her son’s mortality. When a car hits Sam and Nicky’s son, their lives are thrown into turmoil when tests discover he has leukaemia and neither of the parents is an exact match and life saving donor—he is not Nicky’s son. Sam discloses that when backpacking as a teenager with her friend in Australia, she became involved with Michael Tyler, a known bank robber who was eventually caught and imprisoned by Detective Daryl Quint, but whom escapes after Sam returns to Australia to try and persuade him to save their child. Quint, convinced that Sam and Michael still have feelings for one another, charges her with being an accomplice after she is forced to drive Michael away following an arranged meeting intercepted by the police. A veritable hot bed of beaches, slow tracking, swanky looking Sydney city shots and dogged law enforcement as represented by Quint (McInnes), the cast includes Tom Long, Kate Ashfield, Hugo Speer, William McInnes and Martin Sacks. Directed by Rowan Woods (The Boys), who has made a career out of directing for the small screen.

results.title: Do not fold, staple, spindle, or mutilate
results.creator_credit: John Howe and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Written by New York playwright Millard Lampell and starring Hollywood’s Ed Begley, this film tells the story of an aging union leader who, after a lifetime of service for the cause, finds that he has outlived his usefulness and esteem among the workers of his factory, that times have changed and a new strategy is needed in bargaining with the company. It is the situation of a man who must retire.

results.title: Do it yourself cartoon kit
results.brief_description: A satire on cartoons, home hobbyists, and box-top specials, in which the viewer is offered an animation kit, complete with noises, cut-out characters and stick-anything adhesive glue, all for fifty guineas and three detergent box tops. Very much in the Monty Python style - made by Keith Learner, Nancy Hanna, Bob Godfrey and Vera Linnecar.

results.title: Do it his way: a case for adapted intelligence tests
results.brief_description: Children with handicaps are often placed at a distinct disadvantage by most intelligence tests. This film advocates adapting tests to fit the needs of a child’s handicap so that true abilities can be measured. Psychologist Zola Anderson modifies psychological testing procedures to fit the abilities of a six-year-old child with cerebral palsy and a four-year-old child with mild mental retardation.
